column4: hi how do i make my old home folder my new home folder? i am a suse transplant
just edit your fstab to mount your old one in plcae
ubotu sent you a link, read it ;)  no need to use ubuntuguide
you could always mount your other one inside this one, or ditch the small one and just use the big one
change your fstab, to not mount the small one as home, and to mount the big one as home.
are you sharing this home between OSs? or switching entirely?

alright.  What you'llw ant to do is remove any config files you may have, or at the very least copy over your ubuntu ones (from your current home folder) to the new one, because the config syntaxes might be different between program versions
and then just switch the mount point, and you'll be fine
~ is the path of your home directory, which can also be written as /home/username/
you'll want to copy your ubuntu stuff over, make sure you get the hidden stuff too (those are folders/files that start with a .)

what you could/probably should do, is delete all the config stuff from your old home, just keep your personal data stuff in there, and then copy everything over, then you won't have to worry about mitigating conflicts, etc
remove all config files, usually they're .programname, either as a folder or a file.  then copy everything from your current ubuntu home, then fstab change, yep.
sure, you'll need to tweak your user though
you can also do it via GUI in the users menu thing
change the umask in your fstab
or, use sudo to make yourself that user (sudo -u name)
you'll want to chown the whole thing then, probably
